lesson.title_and_level: Upper-Intermediate - Saved by the Gong: Geology

sentence.idiomatic: He pointed to the chair beside him and motioned me to sit down.
Those who agree to doing it this way please raise your hand to show your consent.
The subway exit diagram is too confusing; it's given me a headache.
I've heard that there are a lot of bad things about not eating breakfast.
No one can live in the newly renovated house. The fumes are harmful to people's health.
Taking drugs not only harms the individual and their family, it also causes great harm to society.
The typhoon caused a lot of buildings to collapse.
It is said that there are many factors that will cause the stock market to crash in the near future.
The blizzard caused power outages in many areas.
You can't pile things up like that, it's all going to fall down.
The construction on that bridge was not up to standard. It was just completed and it already collapsed.
With just a few sticks propping it up, if it didn't collapse it would be strange.
I squeezed out from under the table, nobody else knows.
Perhaps the key fell under the bed, squeeze under there and take a look.
What are you squeezing in and out of the crowd for? It's very dangerous.
I've never seen such a magnificent view of the rising tide before.
Everyone was mesmerized by the scope of the magnificent wedding ceremony.
Having gone through such long preparations, I think the opening ceremony of the Olympics will certainly be magnificent.
Have you reviewed for Geology yet? More than anything, I don't get geology charts. How about we go over it together?
OK. Which one?
According to the first chart, how come our country has so many earthquakes?
Take a look at it, what does it say?
If I knew why would I ask you? Come on, dude.
Oh, it's because of the world's two most famous seismic fault lines.
Wow. Xu Xiaoting really is a computer!
Also, look at the location of China.
Our country is located right between the two seismic belts!
Yes! That's why our country has so much seismic activity.

Oh, the second chart shows the Tangshan large earthquake. What destruction did the earthquake cause? This I know. Houses collapsed, people were crushed. It was so tragic! Luckily, we weren't born in Tangshan.
The Tangshan earthquake occurred in 1976, how could you be around?
That's right too. Earthquakes cause so much destruction. What would we do if there was an earthquake? Squeeze under the table!

word.literal: to run around all over the place

sentence.idiomatic: Uh-huh. Squeeze under the table, hide in the corner--just don't run around like crazy. Everyone running around bumping into each other. It would be madness.
Look at these pictures of volcanoes erupting!
Erupting Volcanoes! That's awesome!
You call it awesome? Volcanoes erupt and cause terrible destruction!
Exactly, when volcanoes erupt, out comes extremely hot lava, volcanic ash, steam, and so on.
It's all right though, the book says our country has many extinct volcanoes, but few active volcanoes. Oh, but then there are those dormant volcanoes that could become active any day...
